This Website Design
GitHub for the website "source"
When I originally made a website, I used Publii, which is a WSYIWYG static site generator. Publii worked good, but I wanted a bit more control over the layout and organizaiton of the site.
cosam.org was my inspiration for the layout of the site, with a sidebar that changed depending on the page.
4dwm.com indpired me to make the site look like a CDE/HP VUE/4DWM desktop. This ended up being a lot of work since I have no experience with web design, except for one class I took in 10th grade making websites in Adobe Dreamwever CS3 (which was very outdated by then). Orignally, it was going to look much closer to cosam.org. I was planning on using https://simplecss.org/ for the styling, but ended up just making my own.
I also wanted the site to be static, so I can host it for free on GitHub Pages. I also wanted no JavaScript, so older computers would at least load the site, even if all the styling didn't work.
